reviewText: Its a okay movie, I purchased it for my collection, and not much I can say other than I can't relate at all to what took place in this movie.

This movie is a great display of Gods' unconditional love, forgiveness, and covenant connections. Many are faced with the lost of their child whether through their own negligence or at the hands of another, but the most important message in this movie is that God love us inspite of the wrong. His love and forgiveness will always meet us where we are, however we must forgive ourselves and others. What are your truths?
This movie was ok....Kim Fields did a solid job acting.  However, I thought the overall storyline could have been written a little better.

This was so touching, moving and meaningful. The surprises towards the end is the real tear jerker. Kim fields did an excellent job and this is for ladies night with the girls. Kleenex will be supplied because to not cry at what happens to these young ladies is crazy.
This was a story that would be good to share with young girls, women who demonstrate that they were ill-prepared to deal with pregancy and motherhood. Well done script and great cast.

I saw this movie on the "UP" channel and it truly touched my heart. It reminded me that we all have a cross to bear in life. Kim Fields gives a beautiful performance as a woman that takes in troubled women in her home. But must also face her own personal demons. It does have one sad scene in the movie, but it's a very good movie.
Enjoyed the cartharsis from the character played by KIm Fields when she was able to come clean about her past.

Great, great movie. Superb acting by all, a heart breaking story and also deeply inspirational. Full of unexpected events, but very much believable. You forget you are watching a movie and start to think it's a documentary. Beautiful in every way.
GREAT SERVICE AND GREAT INSPIRATIONAL MOVIE. WATCH WITH A BOX OF TISSUES

It has been a long time since I have watched a film that has pulled so many emotions out of me in one sitting. The person responsible for this is truly talented and I appreciate this film being made. Although I did not identify with every struggle in the film, I was able to identify and connect with the pain. I was able to be empathetic towards the issues that others may struggle through and find a way to appreciate my own journey by watching this film. This film is exactly why film is art, exactly why films are important and the message that a write puts out should always have a point of some sort. It has the potential to touch someone's life and change another person's life. I love it and I am happy I had my moment alone, from my busy life to watch it and take in the messages. It has helped me smile through my own pain.

It was ok. Expected more from Kim Fields. Strong plot but somewhere the story got lost.  The main character's acting seemed too weak to carry such a heavy story line. The surprise "climax" at the end was burdened by too many conflicts.  Sad, but I lost interest.
Not surprised it went straight to DVD.

True to life and really expresses so many situations faced by young women today.  Kim Fields really plays the part well.  Inspirational in showing that noones life is perfect, and that we all make mistakes that we have to live with. Thank God for second chances, and forgiveness!
I am already sharing this movie, and recommending it.  Everyone that has  seen it love it!  Great cast of ladies.

Thank goodness for independent film making.  It allows our black artist the liberty to create and, produce and act in films that depict our stories.  This is a gritty piece but comes full circle.  It shows that although you may be in dire straits and situations, you do not have to be defined by them.  With discipline and determination you can push through and out of very bad conditions.  I suggest parents view this with teenagers and then have a discourse on making choices and the possible consequences of those choices.
This movie really touched my heart.. It will make you cry and laugh. I would recommend to everyone.. It is an excellent movie for young teens
